title: How can I craft a link to work in other browsers when clicked in Firefox?
content:
We have Firefox ESR deployed in our Enterprise. Our core financial banking system runs on Firefox. Our Intranet page has special javascript code to take advantage of IE's ActiveX so if one were to launch IE, the default page (our intranet) has an icon to our core banking system and if clicked the script uses ActiveX and runs this code: ar oShell = new ActiveXObject("Shell.Application"); var commandtoRun = "C:\\Program Files\\Mozilla Firefox\\firefox.exe" ; oShell.ShellExecute(commandtoRun,"https:/path-to-core-system-web-ui","","open","1"); }

So when they click on the icon which is basically an img with the style of cursor: pointer; it does an onclick launch to that code which launches firefox to the web command. If you open our Intranet page in Firefox or Chrome then ActiveX does not run so it just launches in a new tab the link to our core system.

This week (1/19) we are going live with a new loan origination system. The LoS system vendor claims they want us to use Chrome for their system. Well a few months ago we changed the default browser to Firefox with GPO's and now the issue is our Intranet page opens in Firefox (which works great) as any other, but how can we craft our link to open the Loan Origination System in Chrome? I call B.S. that is only works in Chrome. It seems to work in Firefox to me, but that's all they want to support so if we need help they won't help us unless we are using it in Chrome. I know I'm not happy about it either. I'm just happy to be rid of IE finally. I like Firefox (and Chrome) but if I can do any tricks to craft a link, maybe a javascript function to launch something like commandtoRun = "C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Google\\Chrome\\Application\\chrome.exe", along with the argument with the LoS web URL, that would be great.

Thanks!
creator: kjstech

title: how to get car and movement in delivery maps
content: I recently came back to Firefox but I no longer see a car on any of my delivery maps and I use delivery a lot. Any suggestions on how to fix? Did I miss a setting somewhere?
creator: cjhaley.1001

title: Firefox 84.0.2 showing logins that don't exist
content: I let Firefox store my logins so I don't have to hunt no matter which computer I'm using. Lately, Firefox has decided to show logins that don't exist or haven't been used in decades (yes, DECADES). I ran CTRL-SHIFT- DEL, shut down and and restarted FF and rebooting. The fool things still show. What gives? How can these unneeded items be permanently removed? Thank you.
creator: RealGomer

title: Top Site Icons Not Appearing
content: Hi I've got some top sites pinned to my homepage, but for some reason a decent amount of the icons won't appear even if I change the image url that they're linking to. Is there any way to fix this, I'm a very visual person so having icons makes it much easier to browse

title: Blocked by error message (CORRECTION)
content: In previous version I said "computer" where I meant "computer tech." Nice fella but my machine hasn't worked right since he gave it a tune-up. Howard

title: Blocked by error message
content:
Help, please! After a computer tech worked on my machine I've been unable to use FF. I have no trouble downloading a file, but when I click on "Run" I get this error message: "Can not create temp folder archive." I can't get beyond that. This may be related to 7-Zip, because that program always pops up with the error message. What should I do?

Howard Lewis
creator: ClinicCom

title: Estou Com Problemas para Salvar Boletos Em PDF!
content:
Boa Noite!

Não estou conseguindo salvar boletos no formato PDF!

Na caixa de seleção,onde deveria haver a informação "Microsoft Print to PDF", não há essa possibilidade de seleção. Não consegui navegando,ajuda para resolver o problema. Minha versão do Mozilla está atualizada...

Peço ajuda por gentileza!

Grato!
